alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 12:23PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Crook County through 100 PM MDT... At 1223 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles south of Aladdin, or 15 miles northeast of Sundance, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beulah around 1240 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 197 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
